fields.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
The contract reason defined in the Maintain Employee Contract Reasons task.

The employee contract ID for the contract that you're adding or the new employee contract ID for an existing contract. When no value is specified in the employee contract, Workday creates a new contract with the Employee Contract ID.
The date when the contract takes effect.
The user-defined identifier for the employee contract. This value isn't always unique. If empty, Workday automatically populates the existing value.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
The start date of the contract. Must be on or after the start date of hire or additional job staffing event.

The end date of the worker contract. When there is a pending change job or transfer contract, the end date should be before or the same as the effective date of the Change Job event. If empty, Workday automatically populates the existing value.
The collective agreements for this employee contract.
The Maximum Weekly Hours for the employee contract.
The Minimum Weekly Hours for the employee contract.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
The Contract Description for the employee contract. If empty, Workday automatically populates the existing value.
The date the employee signed the contract. Must be within 1 month of the Contract Start Date and not later than the Contract End Date.
The date the employer signed the contract. Must be within 1 month of the Contract Start Date and not later than the Contract End Date.
You can attach scanned contract images, addendums, or other file attachments.
The date that the review of the employee contract automatically initiates. You must specify an end date for the contract to specify a Contract Review Date.
Unique identifier used to reference an External Pay Group (e.g. a Pay Group marked as "Used in Payroll Interface")
Unique identifier used to reference an External Pay Group (e.g. a Pay Group marked as "Used in Payroll Interface")
Unique identifier used to reference a Pay Period.
Unique identifier used to reference a Pay Period.
Boolean attribute to signify whether the response data for Benefit Plan Data (within Deduction Data) should include Benefit Elections as of the Period Payment Date instead of the Period End Date.
Boolean attribute to signify whether to include Employees who are currently Terminated, but were members of the Pay Group as of the Termination Date.

Pay Period Reference representing the last time the web service operation was requested.  This period will be used to determine the members of the Pay Group as of the period.  For those that are no longer members, they will be included within the response.

Pay Period Reference representing the last time the web service operation was requested.  This period will be used to determine the members of the Pay Group as of the period.  For those that are no longer members, they will be included within the response.

As Of Entry DateTime used within the request for the last time this operation was submitted.  Used to determine the population of the Pay Group as of above Period for all data entered into the system prior to this Entry DateTime.
Unique identifier used to reference an Payee (e.g. Employee).. Supports multiple values.
Unique identifier used to reference an Payee (e.g. Employee).. Supports multiple values.
Unique identifier used to exclude Payee(s) from the extract (e.g. Employee).. Supports multiple values.
Unique identifier used to exclude Payee(s) from the extract (e.g. Employee).. Supports multiple values.
Field And Parameter Initialization Provider Reference. Supports multiple values.
Field And Parameter Initialization Provider Reference. Supports multiple values.
Boolean attribute to signify whether to include Costing Allocation data for the employee.
Used to indicate that the Pay Period Start and End dates should be used for Time Off entry selection.

The "as of the effective date" for the management chain, if different than the response filter "as of effective date."  This can be useful when a manager change is not due a staffing change in the managed worker's history.

When enabled, this option will use the respective Pay Period for Payroll Input Start and End Dates. This replaces the current behavior of using the Begin Entry Moment specified in the Response Date Range Filter to derive the period.
Boolean attribute to signify whether to include Employees who are Purged
The universal identifier of the payees.  All payee roles will be returned for a given universal identifier.. Supports multiple values.
The universal identifier of the payees.  All payee roles will be returned for a given universal identifier.. Supports multiple values.

As_of_Effective_Date_for_Management_Chai.description: The "as of the effective date" for the management chain, if different than the response filter "as of effective date."  This can be useful when a manager change is not due a staffing change in the managed worker's history.

Contract_Description.description: The Contract Description for the employee contract. If empty, Workday automatically populates the existing value.

Contract_End_Date.description: The end date of the worker contract. When there is a pending change job or transfer contract, the end date should be before or the same as the effective date of the Change Job event. If empty, Workday automatically populates the existing value.

Contract_ID.description: The user-defined identifier for the employee contract. This value isn't always unique. If empty, Workday automatically populates the existing value.

Contract_Review_Date.description: The date that the review of the employee contract automatically initiates. You must specify an end date for the contract to specify a Contract Review Date.

Contract_Start_Date.description: The start date of the contract. Must be on or after the start date of hire or additional job staffing event.

Contract_Status_Reference_Employee_Contr.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Contract_Status_Reference_WID.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Contract_Type_Reference_Employee_Contrac.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Contract_Type_Reference_WID.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Date_Employee_Signed.description: The date the employee signed the contract. Must be within 1 month of the Contract Start Date and not later than the Contract End Date.

Date_Employer_Signed.description: The date the employer signed the contract. Must be within 1 month of the Contract Start Date and not later than the Contract End Date.

Effective_Date.description: The date when the contract takes effect.

Employee_Contract_Collective_Agreement_R.description: The collective agreements for this employee contract.

Employee_Contract_ID.description: The employee contract ID for the contract that you're adding or the new employee contract ID for an existing contract. When no value is specified in the employee contract, Workday creates a new contract with the Employee Contract ID.

Employee_Contract_Reason_Reference.description: The contract reason defined in the Maintain Employee Contract Reasons task.

Exclude_Payee_Reference_Employee_ID_Prom.description: Unique identifier used to exclude Payee(s) from the extract (e.g. Employee).. Supports multiple values.

Exclude_Payee_Reference_WID_Prompt.description: Unique identifier used to exclude Payee(s) from the extract (e.g. Employee).. Supports multiple values.

Field_And_Parameter_Criteria_Data_Provid.description: Field And Parameter Initialization Provider Reference. Supports multiple values.
Field And Parameter Initialization Provider Reference. Supports multiple values.

Include_Costing_Allocation_Data_Prompt.description: Boolean attribute to signify whether to include Costing Allocation data for the employee.

Include_Purged_Payees_Prompt.description: Boolean attribute to signify whether to include Employees who are Purged

Include_Terminated_Payees_Prompt.description: Boolean attribute to signify whether to include Employees who are currently Terminated, but were members of the Pay Group as of the Termination Date.

Include_Transfers_Out_Of_Pay_Group_Prior.description: As Of Entry DateTime used within the request for the last time this operation was submitted.  Used to determine the population of the Pay Group as of above Period for all data entered into the system prior to this Entry DateTime.

Pay Period Reference representing the last time the web service operation was requested.  This period will be used to determine the members of the Pay Group as of the period.  For those that are no longer members, they will be included within the response.

Pay Period Reference representing the last time the web service operation was requested.  This period will be used to determine the members of the Pay Group as of the period.  For those that are no longer members, they will be included within the response.

Maximum_Weekly_Hours.description: The Maximum Weekly Hours for the employee contract.

Minimum_Weekly_Hours.description: The Minimum Weekly Hours for the employee contract.

Pay_Group_Reference_Organization_Referen.description: Unique identifier used to reference an External Pay Group (e.g. a Pay Group marked as "Used in Payroll Interface")

Pay_Group_Reference_WID_Prompt.description: Unique identifier used to reference an External Pay Group (e.g. a Pay Group marked as "Used in Payroll Interface")

Pay_Period_Reference_Period_ID_Prompt.description: Unique identifier used to reference a Pay Period.

Pay_Period_Reference_WID_Prompt.description: Unique identifier used to reference a Pay Period.

Payee_Payee_Reference_WID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Payee_Reference_Employee_ID_Prompt.description: Unique identifier used to reference an Payee (e.g. Employee).. Supports multiple values.

Payee_Reference_WID_Prompt.description: Unique identifier used to reference an Payee (e.g. Employee).. Supports multiple values.

Position_Reference_Position_ID.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Position_Reference_WID.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Return_Benefits_as_of_Payment_Date_Promp.description: Boolean attribute to signify whether the response data for Benefit Plan Data (within Deduction Data) should include Benefit Elections as of the Period Payment Date instead of the Period End Date.

Universal_ID_Reference_Universal_Identif.description: The universal identifier of the payees.  All payee roles will be returned for a given universal identifier.. Supports multiple values.

Universal_ID_Reference_WID_Prompt.description: The universal identifier of the payees.  All payee roles will be returned for a given universal identifier.. Supports multiple values.

Use_Pay_Period_for_Payroll_Input_Start_a.description: When enabled, this option will use the respective Pay Period for Payroll Input Start and End Dates. This replaces the current behavior of using the Begin Entry Moment specified in the Response Date Range Filter to derive the period.

Use_Pay_Period_for_Time_Off_Period_Start.description: Used to indicate that the Pay Period Start and End dates should be used for Time Off entry selection.

Worker_Document_Reference.description: You can attach scanned contract images, addendums, or other file attachments.
